column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$4$works well l just not a fan of the plastic film peel offs as those suckers stick to u like glue lol

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$1$5$I'm using Estradiol Transdermal System 0.05 mg/day once weekly patch produced by Sandoz A Novartis Division. The product has greatly improved my symptoms. HOWEVER
column3: it's almost impossible to keep the patch from coming off.  This happens sometimes the first day of application. More often it occurs in the shower. Before applying I clean the area with alcohol to be sure there is nothing to prevent the patch from sticking and I allow plenty of time for the area to dry prior to application. When one comes off I'm usually able to reuse the patch but this should not happen. The medicated side of the patch should not be exposed to anything other than my skin from the time it's applied until I remove it for a new application. My insurance will only approve a one month supply (4 patches) at one time which does not allow time to get replacements should I have to throw one away. I would love to know if the company is working to address this problem because I have seen other reviews listing this as an issue.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$2$Been on Miniville for years.  Just was witched to Generic Estradoil 60 days ago
column5: patches do no stay on until next dose.  Waste of money. Went back to Miniville

column1: 8$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$9/7/2018 10:44:39 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Estradiol is a life saver for me. Im so thankful. Since using the patches
column2: i have slept better at night
column3: no more hot flashes! Thank you! I've had more energy
column4: probably because i get a good night sleep now
column5: before i was awaken all through the night with terrible hot flashes
column6: i suffered with them severely through out each day too. Not any more :) I haven had any weight gain or side effects from the patches. Havent had them fall off either. The main thing is do not put them where your panty line is on your waiste
column7: i apply mine in the center of my butt cheek
column8: i've never had a problem with them coming off at all.Wish i would have gotten on them a long time ago
column9: instead of letting myself suffer. Total life changer for me.

column5: heart attack. I do have all the menopausal symptoms. I have 1 remaining ovary. I'm also on a weight loss program. And as bad as it sounds I do not want to gain any weight. My question is: is taking this drug really nec or is it to only alleviate symptoms? I asked my nurse the same ? And she said yes it's nec esp foe osteoporosis..is that It? I'm 48 I don't want to die from the side effects before I even have a chance to get the osteoporosis. Can anyone help with this? Or less me to where I can get an answer as to what to do. Thank you so much (the ratings are not true just to post the ?)

column1: 16$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$12/22/2015 7:59:33 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$1$5$Used on my bottom. Felt great. After about 18 months started developing rash under patch off and on

column3: then severe back pain and finally debilitating pelvic pain. It wasn't until I stopped using it because of the rashes that I realized it was all connected. Two weeks after stopping it all was normal.  Went back to pill and lower estrogen with night sweats. At least the pain is gone.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$4$"I started using this patch after hormonal changes due to a benign brain tumor surgery near my pituitary gland. column1: Side effects I've noticed are clear breast discharge

column1: 20$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$2/1/2014 5:56:53 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$3$I have been using this patch for almost 3 years after a total hysterectomy. Last week I changed back to my tummy and broke out in a terrible rash where the patch was.  It was awful.  Going to try it on my backside again and hope I don't get a rash again!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"My health plan just changed coverage from a larger patch to this little patch

55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I have had ms for 47 years. Post menopausel
column3: I used oral Ogen for years. Then my presciption program stopped covering my Ogen but WOULD cover this patch. Loved the idea of not taking a pill every day. The patch stayed on.

column1: When I started getting diarrhea and suddenly couldn't make it to the bathroom on time
column2: just thought it was my ms. After cleaning up a mess all through my livingroom and a bathroom that looked like a haircoloring bottle had burst
column3: I removed the patch and waited.

column2: no more diarrhea
column3: no more fear of going for a walk or a drive
column5: I'll just live with the night sweats.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on this medication for 6 years. I started out on premarin
column4: with nervousness. Doctor tried me on Clamira 0.05mg. And it was wonderful. Made me feel like my old self again. I like the idea of taking a low dose of hormone. And this one of the lowest they make. Plus no pill to take. Change patch once a week and I'm good to go. Be sure when you put it on that you rub for 10 seconds around the outer egde so it will stick better.
